chargeHist.descr: Prescription Drugs- False or Forged Prescription Order
Prescription Drugs- False or Forged Prescription Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ibrahim A Muhammad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft- Financial Gain, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:23 AM cases 22CF179, 22CF686 called. Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Ibrahim A Muhammad.  Prosecuting Attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ibrahim A Muhammad appeared by video. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant waives right to a personal appearance. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. 

22CF179 Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 5: Identity Theft-Financial Gain and Count 7: Possession of Narcotic Drugs Second or Subsequent Offense

Court accepts the pleas and finds the Defendant guilty.

Defendant makes statement.

Court order:
Sentence withheld 3 years probation
No Contact with Walgreens or CVS any location
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities except in a therapeutic setting. 
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Court costs.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 


Remaining charges are dismissed and read.
Elements of the Offense
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (unsigned, but acknowledged by defendant)
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights (unsigned, but acknowledged by defendant)
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:30 PM cases 22CF179, 22CF686 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ibrahim A Muhammad appeared by video.  Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Ibrahim A Muhammad. There is a joint recommendation and parties would like to set a plea and sentencing. State plans to make their sentencing based off a PSI in a Monroe county case set to resolve end of July. 
A plea sentencing is scheduled for 08-26-2022 at 9:30 AM (via zoom). Court has a colloquy with defendant regarding a video appearance for the next hearing. 
Defendant will need to waive their right to appear in person for the plea and waive the preliminary hearing in 22CF686.

Conditions:
No contact with any CVS Pharmacy or Walgreens unless to fill a valid prescription.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
(Covers 22CF686, 22CF179)
Status conference on July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders the bond in 22CF179 also applies to case 22CF686.
Defendant waives reading of Information in case 22CF179 and enters Not Guilty pleas which are received.
Status Conference in 22CF179 and Hearing in 22CF686 scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 1:30 pm via Zoom.
